title: Ticket #7588: cross-slot posting of p-slot Child attrs needs work to be reliable
description:
CHTC was attempting to use a bologna-backfill style configuration to allow GPUs to be assigned to both a primary p-slot and a set of backfill static slots, with the backfill slots getting out of the way when the p-slot was using the GPUs.

This did not work because the configuration to do this requires that the static backfill slots be able to see the assigned gpus of the d-slots. This can be configured by 

config fragment
STARTD_PARTITIONABLE_SLOT_ATTRS = AssignedGPUs
STARTD_SLOT_ATTRS =  Cpus Memory ChildAssignedGPUs
This should result in the following attributes being advertised in all slots which allows them to be used in the backfill slot START and PREEMPT expressions 
slot attributes
slot1_ChildAssignedGPUs = {<list of GPU devices in use by d-slots>}
slot1_Memory = <unused p-slot memory>
slot1_Cpus = <unused p-slot gpus>
This problem is that the order of operations inside the startd makes the value of slot1_ChildAssignedGPUs very likely to be out of sync with the actual value. When a d-slot is destroyed, it tends to be wrong for quite a long time.

Even worse, in the general case, where STARTD_CRON or custom expressions are in use, and also cross-slot posted, the slot<x>_* values can end up being out of sync all or most of the time, and the behavior is not even stable, since the evaluation order of slots within the Startd changes over time (the state of the slot affects the order)

The solution to this is many fold.

  1. Surgery on the Startd to make the evaluation/update order stable and ordered to support the most common case, which is to always to Child* rollup before SLOT_ATTRS.
  2. Introduce a new cross-slot reference mechanism that is not (as) dependent on update order and is more point-to point than broadcast. This will take the form of a custom classad function specific to the Startd. Expressions in STARTD_ATTRS can use this function 
    config fragment
    STARTD_ATTRS = PslotGpusInUse
PslotGpusInUse = SlotEval("slot1",join(",", ChildAssignedGpus))
SLOT_TYPE_2_START = !StringListIMember(AssignedGpus, PslotGpusInUse)
    The SlotEval classad function will exist only in the Startd, when it is evaluated, the result of the expression will be the same in all slots, it will only reference attributes in the named slot. (slot1 in this case).
  3. Possible future work to change the Startd so that all slot ads are built before any cross-slot posting is done. This is quite a large change to the way the startd operates, but may desirable for other reasons as well.

more on SlotEval

When an expression containing SlotEval is sent anywhere outside the Startd, it will be replaced with the current evaluated value as part of the process of unparsing the ad to put it on the wire (or write it to a file, etc). So the negotiator will see this 

slot ad fragment
ChildAssignedGpus = {"CUDA0", "CUDA1"}
PslotGpusInUse = "CUDA0, CUDA1"

SlotEval is a direct cross-slot lookup at evaluation time, so it is immune the relative order in which STARTD_SLOT_ATTRS and STARTD_PARTITIONABLE_SLOT_ATTRS are processed. It also does not result in a large number of undesireable attrributes being cross posted to all slots. Contrast this with each slot slot getting 40 attributes from one STARTD_SLOT_ATTRS value when there are 40 slots on the machine. 

config fragment
# this results in slot1_Foo through slotN_Foo in all slots
STARTD_SLOT_ATTRS = Foo
# this results in slot1_Foo (and ONLY that) in all slots and all slots get the same result from evaluating Foo
STARTD_ATTRS = slot1_Foo
slot1_Foo = SlotEval("slot1",<epression>)
